Sequence Information.Function: Blocks specifically the Kv3.4/KCNC4 potassium channel. Reduces blood pressure.

Literature.Title: Sea anemone peptides with a specific blocking activity against the fast inactivating potassium channel Kv3.4.
Literature.Author: Lazdunski M.,Beress L.,Schweitz H.,Diochot S.

Literature.Title: A proton nuclear magnetic resonance study of the antihypertensive and antiviral protein BDS-I from the sea anemone Anemonia sulcata: sequential and stereospecific resonance assignment and secondary structure.
Literature.Author: Gronenborn A.M.,Beress L.,Clore G.M.,Driscoll P.C.

Literature.Title: Determination of the three-dimensional solution structure of the antihypertensive and antiviral protein BDS-I from the sea anemone Anemonia sulcata: a study using nuclear magnetic resonance and hybrid distance geometry-dynamical simulated annealing.
Literature.Author: Clore G.M.,Beress L.,Gronenborn A.M.,Driscoll P.C.
